explanation: Tom claims he attended his son's basketball game Wednesday evening from 6 to 7:30 PM. But Clue 3 reveals Lincoln Middle School had no basketball game on Wednesday, and his son confirms Tom dropped him at a friend's house at 5:30 PM and was not seen until 11 PM. Tom fabricated the game to cover several unaccounted hours. Clue 2 shows the basement lights were on around 10 PM, and Clue 1 confirms someone ordered specialty archival paper. Tom used his knowledge of the combination lock and his free evening to swap the ledger pages.
funFact: In 2018, a county clerk in the United States was caught altering digital property records to benefit a relative's real estate deal, resulting in a five-year prison sentence.
